pageContext.claim: “So $100 billion a year we lose on trade with Mexico, on top of that they have a tax, that tax at 17 percent that we don't have.”
pageContext.analysis: Mexico has a 16 percent VAT, but it applies to all businesses and therefore is not a trade barrier, as Trump suggests. Trump often says the U.S. has a trade deficit with Mexico of $100 billion, but his number is way off. According to the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, the U.S. had a trade deficit of $64.1 billion with Mexico in 2017, counting goods and services. Drugs entering through Mexico in many cases get smuggled through U.S. ports of entry or via underground tunnels, not "because we have no wall."
